intro: Meiocarpidium ugandense, commonly known as the Uganda meiocarpidium, is a rare and endemic fern species found primarily in the tropical rainforests of Uganda. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires high humidity and well-drained soil to flourish. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the underside of its fronds, a common feature among ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Meiocarpidium ugandense is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
